full_summary:
### Janitorial Services for RCMP Cross Lake Detachment

#### solicitationNumber
M5000-20-03258/A

#### publicationDate
2023-03-21

#### tenderClosingDate
2023-05-01T16:00:00

### Description

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) seeks bids from qualified contractors for providing janitorial services at the RCMP Cross Lake Detachment in Manitoba. The contract is for two years with an option to extend for up to three additional one-year periods. The successful bidder will be required to provide labour, materials, equipment, transportation, and daily site supervision to maintain a clean and safe environment.

### Important Dates

* Publication Date: March 21, 2023
* Tender Closing Date: May 01, 2023 at 16:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: None
* Expected Contract End Date: None

### Key Requirements

* Security Clearance: The successful contractor must possess a security clearance.
* Site Visit: A site visit is available to prospective bidders.
* Payment Terms: The payment terms will be outlined in the contract.
* Contract Period: The contract period will be for two years with an option to extend for up to three additional one-year periods.

### Submission Requirements

* Bids must be submitted electronically through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities.
* The bid must comply with all requirements outlined in the Invitation to Tender (ITT) and Annex A - Janitorial Services.
* The bid must include a security clearance declaration.

### Contact Information

* Name: Sheena Simonson
* Email: [sheena.simonson@rcmp-grc.gc.ca](mailto:sheena.simonson@rcmp-grc.gc.gc.ca)
* Phone: 306-515-1653
* Address: 6101 Dewdney Avenue, Regina, SK S4P 3K7

### Procedural Requirements

* Canada retains the right to negotiate with any supplier on any procurement.
* The Integrity Regime administered by Public Services and Procurement Canada applies to all RCMP contracting activities.
* Canada will make available Notices of Proposed Procurement (NPP), bid solicitations, and related documents for download through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS).
